oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Mt. Ararat MB: side view
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: West, Carroll Van, photographer
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Color photograph of church side. The church is a gable-fronted, brick building. A sided portico is visible at the front of the church. A side addition intersects the main section at the rear. A parking lot is located to the side of the building.

Mount Ararat Missionary Baptist Church is located in Trezevant, Tennessee. The church has occupied its current building since the mid-twentieth century. The brick building reflects two major building periods: 1952 when the building was constructed under the pastorate of Reverend E.G. Carroll and the 1980s when a sided portico was added. A large cemetery sits to the side of the church.
